image.altText: A man and a woman stand on a beach with their arms around each other. They have grave expressions on their faces.

props.synopsis: Peter Correy was tricked into sending $450,000 to an Australian oil company. A financial crime expert warns criminals are exploiting weaknesses in Australia's regulatory system to get away with laundering.

title.children: 'We were scammed, he was scammed': How criminals used an Australian company to launder money

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: The issue of housing affordability in Australia was once confined almost entirely to home ownership, but has now boiled over into the rental market. Is it even possible to unwind a property bubble that's been two decades in the making?

title.children: Will the housing affordability crisis eat us up?

image.altText: A man looks over the water, with an Australian Border Force badge on his arm

props.synopsis: A series of recent boat arrivals in WA's north has led a local shire president to believe the region's coastline is being specifically targeted, arriving in small communities near air bases.

title.children: 'Pretty good navigators': Shire president says boat arrivals 'well informed' and targeting WA's north

image.altText: A submarine with a red, white and blue flag on the front sits on an empty patch of concrete

props.synopsis: Australia and its AUKUS partners, the US and UK, are considering including Japan in some of the alliance's advanced technology projects, the three countries' defence ministers confirm.

title.children: China 'gravely concerned' as Australia, US, UK confirm Japan considered for AUKUS

image.altText: A man wearing special glasses over his eyes.

props.synopsis: A total solar eclipse sees millions of people across North America watch as the Moon completely blocks the Sun, for more than four minutes in some places.

title.children: Millions take in total solar eclipse across North America

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu wearing suit stands in front of flag of Israel

props.synopsis: Details of an agreement struck between Australia and Israel on defence industry cooperation will not be released publicly over concerns the information could damage Australia's "international relations".

title.children: Details of defence deal with Israel kept under wraps to protect Australia's 'reputation'

image.altText: Bespectacled woman with brown hair and yellow top sitting standing in front of new smart power meter

props.synopsis: Economists love them. Regulators say they make the grid more efficient. But many Australians are finding out time-of-use tariffs mean sharply higher power prices.

title.children: Anger and despair as electricity customers shifted to 'punishing' tariffs

image.altText: A close-up shot of Daniel Martin Torrijos getting into a car, wearing sunglasses and a white shirt.

props.synopsis: The youth custodial officer who found Cleveland Dodd unresponsive in his cell has told a coronial inquest into the teenager's death that the tragedy could have been avoided. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Youth custodial officer tells inquest Cleveland Dodd's death was preventable

image.altText: Scott Morrison with Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare

props.synopsis: A strongly worded document from Tonga's Foreign Affairs Ministry gives insight into the Pacific nation's view of Australia and New Zealand's diplomatic efforts.

title.children: 'Nothing short of frantic': Documents show Tonga criticised Australia and NZ's response to China-Solomon security pact

image.altText: A photo of Lani. She is in her early 20s, has fair skin, blue eyes and long blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Workers employed under awards, who also provide care to loved ones with ongoing conditions, say a "cumbersome and burdensome" leave process has left them struggling to get basic entitlements.

title.children: 'I left my job because of it': Workers who care for loved ones say leave requirements require too much paperwork

image.altText: An X-ray printout showing a pelvis with two hips replaced.

props.synopsis: Smart people are getting caught out on private health insurance — so do they need to be more savvy, or does the system need to change?

title.children: Find health insurance hard to navigate? Linda was shocked to find her hip replacement wasn't covered

image.altText: A mechanical piece of equipment - an electrolyser - on display on a table.

props.synopsis: The Gladstone Electrolyser Facility in central Queensland will be the first facility in Australia to build electrolysers at a commercial scale.

title.children: What are hydrogen electrolysers and can they help lead Australia to a fossil fuel-free future?

image.altText: A man in a blue suit, white shirt and blue and white stripped tie looks at the camera and pumps his fist

props.synopsis: In the video, Donald Trump says he supports exceptions for rape, incest and to protect the life of the mother.

title.children: Donald Trump says US states should handle abortion law, stopping short of suggesting a national ban in new video

image.altText: Jim Chalmers at a press conference with his mouth closed.

props.synopsis: The federal government says it supports fines of up to 10 per cent of Coles' and Woolworths' annual revenue if they are found to be mistreating suppliers, as it begins to move on the supermarket giants.

title.children: Government backs multi-million-dollar penalty regime for Coles and Woolworths over anti-competitive behaviour

image.altText: A young man leans on the open door of a car.

props.synopsis: Conflict in the Middle East and Ukraine, improved economic conditions in the US and China and cuts to production have combined to drive the price of crude oil up. Converted to petrol and diesel, it's shipped to Australia, and the cost of it is only going one way: up.

title.children: Our addiction to petrol is going to get more expensive in the coming weeks and months

image.altText: Man in military uniform.

props.synopsis: A criminal investigation could be launched into the drone strikes that killed Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom, says an IDF spokesperson who calls the incident "clearly a mistake".

title.children: 'Must be Hamas': IDF spokesperson launches defence of drone strikes that killed Australian aid worker

image.altText: Part of a road destroyed

props.synopsis: Storms have washed away the only access road to the Megalong Valley in the Blue Mountains, leaving 200 people cut off and business facing huge losses.

title.children: Helicopter drops food, supplies to NSW community isolated by landslide

image.altText: Pope Francis speaks into a microphone while reading from a sheet of paper

props.synopsis: The Vatican declares sex reassignment operations and surrogacy as grave threats to human "dignity", putting them on par with abortion and euthanasia as practices that violate God's plan for human life.

title.children: Vatican condemns sex reassignment surgery, surrogacy and gender theory as threats to human 'dignity'

image.altText: Actor Jonathan Majors arrives at court in New York City

props.synopsis: The former rising star of Creed III is sentenced to probation after he was convicted of misdemeanour assault by a Manhattan jury last year.

title.children: Actor Jonathan Majors avoids jail after assaulting ex-girlfriend

image.altText: A man wearing glasses, with a grey beard, sits by a window with a curtain, his face partially in shadow.

props.synopsis: More than 3 million Australians have chronic pain. This treatment is popular, but it's putting lives at risk.

title.children: 'I miss my mate': David's wife of 43 years died after a popular procedure to treat pain

image.altText: Warren Entsch with a flower painted on his face with two people in marvel t-shirt

props.synopsis: Images of a federal MP in fancy dress appear to have contradicted claims he was unaware his wife was being paid to run face-painting and dress-up classes by a business that had government contracts.

title.children: Images of federal MP appear to contradict claims he was unaware his wife was paid to run dress-up and face-painting classes

image.altText: Silhouette of a crowd in front of a stage with warm white lights at night and a red triple j flag

props.synopsis: After a five-year break, Triple J is excited to announce that One Night Stand is returning this year.

title.children: One Night Stand is back for 2024: Want to host the party?

image.altText: A window with the words law courts printed on it

props.synopsis: Jason Raymond Patterson has pleaded not guilty to murdering his sister in the front yard of their Deniliquin home in late 2021, with his trial expected to centre around whether he was suffering a mental health impairment at the time.

title.children: Man accused of murdering sister and setting her body alight believed she was 'possessed'

image.altText: Foreign minister Penny Wong faces the media in Adelaide 2024-04-06 100400__c03a7caeb3c81889ce55bcb98d97cb664019b1f5

props.synopsis: The federal government has appointed former ADF chief Mark Binskin to monitor Israel's response to its air strikes which killed Australian Zomi Frankcom. What will he do?

title.children: What will Australia's special adviser on Israel's air strikes achieve?

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man will appear in the Ballarat Magistrates' Court on Tuesday, charged with the murder of Clunes woman Hannah McGuire.

title.children: Man, 21, charged with murder after 23yo woman's body found near Ballarat

image.altText: Two women, one holding a young child.

props.synopsis: For the first time, Kumanjayi Petrick's family speak about their loss, one month since the stolen car crash that took his life and sparked violent unrest in Alice Springs.

title.children: Alice Springs family speaks out about town's violence after fatal crash of teenage relative

image.altText: A large ring of white gasses can be seen in the sky.

props.synopsis: Mount Etna has released volcanic vortex rings, a rare phenomenon caused by a constant release of vapours and gases.

title.children: Vortex rings rise from Italy's Mount Etna volcano

image.altText: A photo of two men standing in a room with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: NSW Police says the two men will be "dealt with locally" in the African country after the 16-year-old took his own life having engaged online with a person he thought was a "young woman".

title.children: Australian teenager who took his own life was allegedly extorted by two Nigerian men pretending to be a 'young woman'

image.altText: A man wearing glasses, smiling

props.synopsis: Photographer Robert William Brown, 75, died after he was allegedly robbed of his backpack and pushed over at a taxi rank outside a Toowoomba shopping centre.

title.children: Teenager accused of pushing elderly man at taxi rank pleads guilty to manslaughter

image.altText: A man speaks to media outside of court with supporters around him

props.synopsis: Former Advertiser deputy editor Ben Hyde, who was horrifically injured by a speeding driver in Adelaide's CBD, confronts the man in court, telling him of the ongoing effects of the crash on his life and career.

title.children: News Corp former deputy editor confronts 170kph driver who 'left me in a burning car'

image.altText: A baby Western Ringtail Possum.

props.synopsis: A University of Western Australia study finds the coastline between Margaret River and Walpole needs to be protected as it will be an important refuge for vulnerable possums affected by climate change.

title.children: This popular WA region has been earmarked as a 'climate refuge' for vulnerable possums

image.altText: Compile photo of a hand holding a mobile phone with a phone tower image on it

props.synopsis: The 3G network is closing and there are concerns Australians with older 4G phones may also be caught out because of the way the phones are configured.

title.children: More than a million older mobile phones at risk of being blocked from making triple-0 calls

image.altText: Artist stands next to his pink patchwork painting on the wall in a gallery space

props.synopsis: Artist Henry Jock Walker has spent thousands of hours surfing, and it has all been invaluable research for his vibrant, nostalgic artworks made of recycled wetsuits.

title.children: At first glance, Henry Jock Walker's artworks 'look like abstract paintings'. Look again
